info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 1:14PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Prepare for Strong Wind, Snow and Cold above 7500` on Mt. Shasta This Weekend... The first significant change in the weather for the fall season is upon us. A cold upper low pressure system will move into the region Saturday, causing winds to increase with falling snow levels on Mount Shasta. Saturday afternoon and night, snow levels will fall to around 7500` with 5 to 10 inches of snow possible by Monday morning. In addition to the falling snow, strong winds on the order of 30 to 50 mph with gusts to around 80 mph are expected. Conditions will linger into Sunday. Climbers are urged to prepare for the weather and consider alternate plans.
